paragraphs.content: Chapter 15
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 15

paragraphs.content: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.
paragraphs.contentHtml: After these things the word of the Lord came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.

paragraphs.content: And Abram said, Lord GOD, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Abram said, Lord God, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?

paragraphs.content: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.

paragraphs.content: And, behold, the word of the LORD came unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And, behold, the word of the Lord came unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.

paragraphs.content: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.

paragraphs.content: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he believed in the Lord; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto him, I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto him, I am the Lord that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.

paragraphs.content: And he said, Lord GOD, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said, Lord God, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?

paragraphs.content: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.

paragraphs.content: And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.

paragraphs.content: And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when the fowls came down upon the carcases, Abram drove them away.

paragraphs.content: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.

paragraphs.content: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;

paragraphs.content: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.

paragraphs.content: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.

paragraphs.content: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.

paragraphs.content: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.

paragraphs.content: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:
paragraphs.contentHtml: In the same day the Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:

paragraphs.content: The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,

paragraphs.content: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaims,

paragraphs.content: And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.
